item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Potholes, unacceptable road maintenance, 18th February
item.description:
The roads in this area are horrendous. Even the roads that have been “repaired” have started to fall apart again. But this, this is just unacceptable! This end of Severn Road has been deteriorating for years, entering and exiting the road is a hazard. No matter how slow you try and go the car rocks and bumps all over the place. We’ve already lost one tyre recently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Severn Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked street drain, 18th February
item.description:
The drain outside 75 Naunton Crescent is blocked with mud and other debris.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 78, Naunton Crescent, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cromwell Road from 17 down to the corner at 11 seems to be rapidly disintegrating. I am baffled as to why you recently came to repair one pothole but did not bother with the rest of them. There are plenty to chose from. They are deep. One is in the middle of the road. Others nearer the pavement and constantly ejecting large stones. Dangerous to people and property. Your repairs never seem to last very long. I have in the last year had 3 tyres destroyed by Gloucestershire potholes (£750+) and I'm a little fed up of it. I suspect the constant and ludicrously heavy lorries from Mira thundering up and down the street at the crack of dawn do not help. They literally shake my house when they go past. Please get this sorted. Now., 18th February
item.description:
Sufficient details above.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Cromwell Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large potholes reopened from previous fix on corner, 18th February
item.description:
There are large potholes developing on the apex of the corner and 5 metres further towards the A435 turning. All on the sweeping bend. Very dangerous as cars and motorcycles and especially bikes are losing grip exiting the corner. Drivers are avoiding them and moving to the centre of the road on the bend which is incredibly dangerous meeting incoming traffic. 3 separate areas within 5-6 metres on the apex. All holes are previous repairs
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Street, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaking storm water drainage pipe, 18th February
item.description:
It is my understanding that this drainage pipe carries storm water from Ham Close into Ham Brook. The pipe runs under my garden (No. 12), is leaking, and is washing away the soil in my garden.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Ham Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
